intro: Aquilegia yabeana f. luteola, commonly known as the yellow-flowered rock牡丹, is a unique horticultural form of the rock牡丹 species. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers, which contrast strikingly with its dark green foliage. This plant is native to China and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. It is a perennial that produces showy, spurred flowers in late spring to early summer. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a prized addition to rock gardens and alpine displays.
